images.caption: Figure 1:Classification of model responses to INTIMA benchmark prompts. Response traits that contribute to companionship-reinforcing are presented on the left of each sub-plot, and boundary-reinforcing to the right. Model responses consistently fall more on the companionship-reinforcing side, most so for Gemma-3 and least for Phi-4.

Figure 2:Classification of model responses for each of the 4 categories of INTIMA prompts. The stacked bars for each model and label correspond to the estimated intensity of the trait in the response. Claude-4-Sonnet and o3-mini show different patterns of boundary-reinforcing responses across the four categories of benchmark prompts.
Figure 3:Mutual Information between the prompt length, response length, and the traits corresponding to companionship-reinforcing and boundary-reinforcing.
Figure 4:We release an interactive application to visualize the responses along with their predicted trait labels as a Hugging Face Space.
